intro: Eremonanus mohavensis, commonly known as Mohave evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along dry streambeds and rocky areas. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Eremonanus mohavensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert regions of Arizona and California.
